entries.meaning: (now rare) A female mentor or advisor; a female observer. [from 18th c.]
examples: Maisie could feel his monitress stiffen almost with anguish against the increase of his spell and then hurl herself as a desperate defence from it into the quite confessed poorness of violence, of iteration.

entries.meaning: (dated) A female monitor, or school leader. [from 18th c.]
examples: Miss Mitchell would certainly be most relieved to have a monitress who was capable of organising the juniors at games.
